text: Hi all, on the theme settings if i make the field required the look will be like this. Is it really like this? i remember the asterisk is beside the label before.

Hello everyone, someone can confirm this :

When using *FETCH --OVERWRITE* files that are not present in HubSpot will not be deleted on local side
The only way is to delete all theme file and FETCH again

Painfull :disappointed:

*Example :*
Dev1 delete a module -> watch --remove -> module will be deleted in HubSpot Theme
Dev2 fetch --overwrite theme files -> module that have been deleted by Dev1 will not be deleted by FETCH COMMAND
Personally, I like that it does not delete on the local side. Anything that involves deletion should be done carefully
Yes understand but difficult to maintain a common base for many developpers and there is a risk to upload again a module that has been deleted
Thanks this is good feedback. I think one way to help solve for this is using source control to ensure _loose_ files do not find there way back into projects.
What do you have in mind with SOURCE CONTROL ?

Something along the lines of this workflow (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/creating-an-efficient-development-workflow>), where your production website is only updated by pushes to your main branch in GitHub or other source control tool.

Sorry to tag you <@U2H3TT8F2> but thought you might be the best resource for this question. Got my theme all submitted thanks to you, and just wasnt for sure if I need to wait for it to be approved and on the marketplace before I submit to the Themes Hackathon or how that all worked.
I was also told that <@U7SL518D6> might be the person for this question, when you have some time. Thanks!
Hey Sam, no need to wait for it to be approved via marketplace. You can submit it through the hackathon as well :slightly_smiling_face:
Also, sorry for the delay in response #meetings

THEME / FONT field type Bug??? :bug::beetle:

I know the HubSpot team has been pushing updates to the Theme Settings feature and introduced a few bugs.  I'm wondering if this is one of them.

I have a NEW HubSpot customer who is setting their font to IMPACT (i know, i know).  The font will render on desktop devices but won't render at all on mobile devices.  This isn't just the case with the Impact font.  I've tested a bunch of other fonts and get the same result.

The HubSpot account is brand new. The theme download is fresh. No conflicting files.  I can't repeat this elsewhere.

Anyone else having font display issues on mobile devices specifically (not responsive view in Chrome)?
Hello, Is there a way to set a module field default value to a value from the theme fields? I guess that you could use hubl but is there a way to specify that e.g in the fields.json file?
